relatedProjects.description: This project section can be used to describe the relationship between this contracting process and a project or programme of work.

id.title: ID
id.description: An externally provided identifier for the project.

title.title: Title
title.description: The name of the project to which this contracting process relates.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short free text description of the project.

sector.description: A high-level categorisation of the main sector this procurement process relates to. Use of UN COFOG codes, with ‘COFOG’ as the classification scheme, and the numerical COFOG code is recommended for the primary sector classification.

scheme.description: An classification should be drawn from an existing scheme or list of codes. This field is used to indicate the scheme/codelist from which the classification is drawn. For line item classifications, this value should represent an known Item Classification Scheme wherever possible.
scheme.title: Scheme

id.description: The classification code drawn from the selected scheme.
id.title: ID

description.description: A textual description or title for the code.
description.title: Description of Sector

uri.description: A URI to identify the code. In the event individual URIs are not available for items in the identifier scheme this value should be left blank.
uri.title: URI

additionalClassifications.description: Additional sector classifications, using local vocabularies where required.

additionalClassifications.title: Additional Classification

locations.description: Information about the location where a project is taking place.

description.description: A name or description of this location. This might include the name(s) of the location(s), or might provide a human readable description of the location to be covered. This description may be used in a user-interface.
description.title: Description of Location

geometry.description: We follow the GeoJSON standard to express basic location information, using latitude and longitude values in the WGS84 (EPSG:4326) projection.

type.description: The type of geoJSON Geometry Objects being provided. To provide latitude and longitude use ‘point’, and enter an array of [latitude,longitude] as the value of coordinates field: e.g. [37.42,-122.085]. Note the capitalisation of type values - set in order to maintain compatibility with geoJSON.
type.title: Type

coordinates.description: The relevant array of points, e.g. [latitude,longitude], or nested array, for the geoJSON geometry being described. The longitude and latitude MUST be expressed in decimal degrees in the WGS84 (EPSG:4326) projection.
coordinates.title: Coordinates

totalValue.description: The total anticipated value of the project over it's lifetime.
totalValue.title: Total Value

uri.description: A URI pointing to further information about this project.
uri.title: URI

relatedProjects.title: Related Projects

contracts.definition: Information regarding the signed contract between the buyer and supplier(s).

implementation.description: Information of the implementation stage of the contract.

relatedProjects.definition: The relatedProjects block can be used to cross-reference between projects using their OCID.

metrics.description: Metrics are used to set out targets and results from a contracting process. In the implementation section it is used to provide updates on actually delivered results, also known as outputs.

description.title: Metric description
description.description: Updates on the actual delivered results

id.title: ID of metric
id.description: An identifier for this metric. In some cases this may be drawn from a codelist of metrics required for this type of contracting process, or in other instances may be an arbitrary identifier.

observations.description: An actual or target observation. Observations should include either a value (for financial metrics) or measure (for other metrics).

measure.title: Metric's observation measure
measure.description: For non-financial metrics, the measure of this forecast, target or actual observation. Measures may be provided as free text or numerical values.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the code. In the event individual URIs are not available for related projects this value should be left blank.
